intro: Tragacantha unijuga, commonly known as the single-lobed tragacanth, is a rare and endangered plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its unique, single-lobed leaf structure. The plant produces yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, and its fruit is a legume pod containing several seeds. Tragacantha unijuga is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments, making it an important component of its local ecosystem.
